lines.text: First things first, we need to find the IP address of the Raspberry Pi. You can look at your router's DHCP table, ask the pi directly, use Netstat, or just start trying to talk to it.
lines.text_raw: First things first, we need to find the IP address of the Raspberry Pi. You can look at your router's DHCP table, ask the pi directly, use Netstat, or just start trying to talk to it.

lines.text: To ask the Pi, simply open the terminal on the Pi's desktop and type "ifconfig" then write down the IP.
lines.text_raw: To ask the Pi, simply open the terminal on the Pi's desktop and type "ifconfig" then write down the IP.

lines.text: To use Netstat, open Utilities and then Network Utility. Click the Netstat tab and the "Display Routing Table Information" radio button.
lines.text_raw: To use Netstat, open Utilities and then Network Utility. Click the Netstat tab and the "Display Routing Table Information" radio button.

lines.text: Got that IP? We're going to open up our terminal on the Mac and type in ssh -X pi@PI_IP_address. My pi is on 192.168.1.2 so I type in ssh -X pi@192.168.1.2
lines.text_raw: Got that IP? We're going to open up our terminal on the Mac and type in '''ssh -X pi@PI_IP_address. ''' My pi is on 192.168.1.2 so I type in '''ssh -X pi@192.168.1.2'''

lines.text: Hit enter and it will ask you for your password. It's probably 'raspberry' unless you changed it.
lines.text_raw: Hit enter and it will ask you for your password. It's probably ''''raspberry'''' unless you changed it.

lines.text: If this is your first time logging into your pi via SSH you'll probably see some stuff about RSA. Just press y to agree until you're looking at the Pi prompt.
lines.text_raw: If this is your first time logging into your pi via SSH you'll probably see some stuff about RSA. Just press '''y''' to agree until  you're looking at the Pi prompt.

lines.text: Now, this is the magic part. Type lxsession into the prompt and hit enter.
lines.text_raw: Now, this is the magic part. Type '''lxsession''' into the prompt and hit enter.

lines.text: Now you're presented with the Raspberry Pi's Desktop!!!
lines.text_raw: Now you're presented with the Raspberry Pi's Desktop!!!

guide.summary: Want to operate your Raspberry Pi headless? Sure you could use VNC software but there's an easier way using X11 on a Mac.
guide.title: Share your Raspberry Pi Desktop Easily with your Mac
